case_title: Chief Executive Officer, Peshawar Electric and Power Company (PEPCO) and another vs Sajeeda Begum and others
appellant: Chief Executive Officer, Peshawar Electric and Power Company (PEPCO)
complaint_summary: Respondents filed writ petitions seeking compensation under the 2014 Prime Minister's Assistance Package for deceased spouses employed by PESCO and WAPDA.
investigation_summary: The Islamabad High Court directed PESCO and WAPDA to compensate Respondents under the 2014 Prime Minister's Assistance Package, which was challenged by PESCO and WAPDA in the Supreme Court.
judgment_summary: The Supreme Court set aside the Islamabad High Court's judgments, ruling that PESCO and WAPDA employees are not government servants and thus not eligible for the 2014 Prime Minister's Assistance Package. The Court also found jurisdictional issues with the Islamabad High Court's decision.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeals allowed; Islamabad High Court judgments set aside.
legal_arguments: PESCO employees are not government servants under any statutory law.
PESCO does not fall within the territorial jurisdiction of the Islamabad High Court.
WAPDA employees are governed by the WAPDA Act and its own Assistance Package.
Beneficial legislation does not apply retrospectively unless explicitly stated.
statutes: Pakistan Water and Power Development Authority Act, 1958
sections: Article 199 of the Constitution of Pakistan, 1973
Sections 1, 3, 17, and 29 of the WAPDA Act
key_issues: Jurisdiction of Islamabad High Court over PESCO and WAPDA.
Eligibility of PESCO and WAPDA employees for government assistance packages.
Applicability of the 2014 Prime Minister's Assistance Package.

maxims.Nemo dat quod non habet: A person cannot give what they do not have.

legal_terms.Body Corporate: An entity recognized by law as having its own legal personality.
legal_terms.Assistance Package: Financial aid provided to families of deceased employees.

words_and_phrases.Territorial Jurisdiction: The authority of a court to hear cases within a specific geographic area.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved appeals by PESCO and WAPDA against Islamabad High Court judgments directing compensation under the 2014 Prime Minister's Assistance Package. The Supreme Court ruled that PESCO and WAPDA employees are not government servants and thus ineligible for the package. Jurisdictional issues were also highlighted.

issues.pesco_jurisdiction: PESCO's headquarters are in Peshawar, KPK, outside the territorial jurisdiction of the Islamabad High Court.
issues.pesco_employees: PESCO employees are not government employees under statutory law.
issues.wapda_package: WAPDA employees are governed by WAPDA's own Assistance Package, not the Prime Minister's Assistance Package.

pesco.jurisdiction: Islamabad High Court lacked jurisdiction over PESCO.
pesco.employee_status: PESCO employees are not government employees.

wapda.jurisdiction: WAPDA is amenable to Islamabad High Court jurisdiction.
wapda.package: WAPDA's Assistance Package was already availed by the respondent, and imposing the Prime Minister's Assistance Package was legally unsustainable.

Director, Social Welfare NWFP v. Saadullah Khan
Muhammad Yusuf Khan v. WAPDA through its Chairman and others

final_decision.pesco: Islamabad High Court's judgment against PESCO set aside.
final_decision.wapda: Islamabad High Court's judgment against WAPDA set aside.
